bibl.note: This is a letter from J. H. Kendrick to Adam Fergusson, dated December 28, 1848. Kendrick writes that there have not been any cases of cholera in or around Nashville.

div1.p: Maj Reynolds Pay master U. S. A arrived here last night The Cholera excitement is not so great here as it was and I am happy to say to you that there has not been a case here yet nor has there been one in 200 miles of this place
There was a man buried at the city grave yard yesterday, who died on a small Boat between here and smithland but he did not die with the Cholera, although it was so reported
